arts.ttl: Nathan Jones on being ‘absolutely abused’ by Charlton Athletic fans - and the need to trust his process
arts.sum: “There has been a lot of noise this week – I got abused by my own fans the other day. Nathan Jones felt that Charlton Athletic’s 1-0 win over League One table-topping Birmingham City was evidence that they should trust his management skills.

arts.ttl: Nathan Jones calls Krystian Bielik 'naive' after using Birmingham City quote against him
arts.sum: Searching for additional motivation beforehand, manager Nathan Jones took an extract from an interview Bielik gave BBC WM after Blues’ win over Peterborough United in which he said the team is ‘too good for League One’. Charlton Athletic plastered a quote from Birmingham City captain Krystian Bielik on their dressing room walls ahead of their meeting with the League One leaders.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City star made to eat his words as unbeaten run ends: 'It's very naive'
arts.sum: Charlton Athletic ended Birmingham City's unbeaten run in League One - and Nathan Jones insisted Krystian Bielik’s comments that they are "too good" for the division was perfect motivation

arts.ttl: Birmingham City player ratings after Charlton end League One unbeaten record
arts.sum: Ben Davies, Scott Wright and Emil Hansson replaced Krystian Bielik, Keshi Anderson and Alfie May. A knock to Bielik at the end of the first half no doubt contributed to his withdrawal. Matty Godden scored the only goal of the game to hand Charlton a 1-0 win over league leaders Blues.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic boss Jones on Bielik’s ‘very naive’ comments firing his side up for big win over Birmingham City
arts.sum: But Matty Godden’s second-half goal – his fourth of the season in all competitions – ended a run of three straight losses for the South Londoners. “We brought him (Godden) in – and spent a lot of money on him – and he is quality,” said Jones.

arts.ttl: What Nathan Jones and every League One boss has said about Birmingham City
arts.sum: Here is everything the eight League One managers who have faced Blues this season have said, plus the thoughts of Charlton Athletic manager Nathan Jones whose team are next up... But it’s played by 11 players and about which team is better not how much money you spend.”

arts.ttl: Birmingham beaten as Matty Godden strike gives Charlton victory
arts.sum: The Blues did not register a shot on target.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic v Birmingham City team line-ups: Five changes made by Nathan Jones for Valley clash
arts.sum: Charlton: Mannion, Ramsay, Mitchell, Jones, Docherty, Coventry, Docherty, A Campbell, Anderson, Kanu, Godden. Birmingham start with two former Charlton players in their ranks – Alfie May and Krystian Bielik.

arts.ttl: Hansson returns: Birmingham City team news and predicted XI to face Charlton Athletic
arts.sum: The latest Birmingham City team news as Chris Davies' side gear up to face Charlton Athletic in League One. The post Hansson returns: Birmingham City team news and predicted XI to face Charlton Athletic appeared first on The72 - Football League News.
